definitions.definition: To express support or approval , especially officially or publicly ; to give an endorsement .
examples: The president endorsed John Smith as senator.

definitions.definition: To write one's signature on the back of a cheque , or other negotiable instrument , when transferring it to a third party, or cashing it.
To add penalty points to one's driving licence as a result of  a road traffic offence.
examples: The court endorsed his driving record with three penalty points for the drink-driving.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To express support or approval , especially officially or publicly ; to give an endorsement .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To write one's signature on the back of a cheque , or other negotiable instrument , when transferring it to a third party, or cashing it.
( transitive , UK , law ) To add penalty points to one's driving licence as a result of  a road traffic offence.
( medicine , transitive ) To report (a symptom ); to describe .
